CatDescriptText: Related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 16, 1960, pg. B3, reads: "School Teacher Becomes Bride of VA Employe [sic] - The marriage of Helen Elizabeth Smith and George Faison took place recently in the Baptist Temple Church with the Rev. J. A. Williams officiating. A reception followed in the social room of the church. The bride was attended by her sister, Mrs. Herbert Sandidge. Garfield Meachem served as the best man. The bride, the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lincoln Smith, is an alumna of the University of Pittsburgh and is a teacher in the Pittsburgh public schools. The groom, the son of the late Alexander Faison and Mrs. Faison, attended Virginia Union University and is employed by the Veteran's Administration. Mrs. Roscoe L. Fleming St. and Mrs. Henry H. Harvey were in charge of the reception. The couple will make their home on Stotler Road in Penn Hills."
TitMainTitle: Groom George Faison and bride Helen Elizabeth Smith Faison posed in Baptist Temple Church
